acidity.notes: Good strong plum note, just a little on the tangy/sour side.

sweetness.notes: Definitely some complexity, just slightly puckery. Needs just a bit more sweetness.

finish.notes: Dark, a little tangy. Tea note on tip of tongue, warmth in throat.

flavor: More complex, 'story-telling', developing flavor and smell. That is great. Base taste is earthy, woody, fruit note is a slightly tangy, 'whining' plum or sour cherry. Aftertaste has both some nice woody sensations but also the unpleasant tang.
notes: 8 second bloom swirl, but I didn't swirl as widely/intensely.
actionItem: Swirl bloom more intensely. We want to maximize drawdown for this grind size to move barely out of the sour phase.
